channel.title: Multiple Servers on the Same PC
channel.description:
Is it possible? If so, how is it done?
If not, any alternatives?

item.title: Multiple Servers on the Same PC
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Whip Mod Whip
item.description:
@Mod_Whip wrote:

Yes, ZYG, this is possible.
To do this, you need different ports for each server. If you want the server to be for you and other people online, you’ll need to port forward all of the ports that you’re using. If you’re not sure how to do this, look in the tutorial section of the forums.

To change the port of a server, you need 1 folder for each server. Open server.java and search for

public static int serverlistenerPort

You should see something like public static int serverlistenerPort = 43594 In this case the port would be 43594. Change that number, then save, exit, compile, run, enjoy

Read full topic
item.source: Multiple Servers on the Same PC

item.title: Multiple Servers on the Same PC
item.dc:creator: @xdeathxmagex xdeathxmagex
item.description:
@xdeathxmagex wrote:

Yes it is possible. Just set them up on different ports in their Server.java files.

~XdeathXmageX
